catplat.specifications.adsorbate module

class catplat.specifications.adsorbate.AdsorbateSpecifications(adsorbate_atoms: str | None = None, adsorbate_formula: str | None = None, bonds: list | tuple | str | NoneType = None, connectivity: list | tuple | int | NoneType = None, avg_coord_num: list | tuple | int | float | NoneType = None, rotation: int | float | NoneType = None)[source]

Generates adsorbate + slab structures.

rotation: int | float | None = None
class catplat.specifications.adsorbate.AdsorbateSpecificationsSet(adsorbate_atoms: list[str | None] | tuple[str | None] | None = None, adsorbate_formula: list[str | None] | tuple[str | None] | None = None, bonds: list[list | tuple | str | None] | tuple[list | tuple | str | None] | None = None, connectivity: list[list | tuple | int | None] | tuple[list | tuple | int | None] | None = None, avg_coord_num: list[list | tuple | int | float | None] | tuple[list | tuple | int | float | None] | None = None, rotation: list[int | float | None] | tuple[int | float | None] | None = None)[source]

Bases: SpecificationsSet

Main class containing the adsorbate attributes provided by the user.

Also contains some error checks for the attributes which are called in the QuerySet.

adsorbate_atoms

Name of adsorbate. Adsorbate can be read from user’s adsorbate directory (~/.autopy/adsorbates or ~/autopy/autopy/data/adsorbates). Some common adsorbates are available from the ASE database.

Type:

list, tuple, None

adsorbate_formula

Formula of adsorbate.

Type:

list, tuple, None

bonds

Atom index of adsorbate to bind to the slab. Default bond = [[0]] for monodentate and [[0,1]] for bidentate adsorbates

Type:

list, tuple, None

connectivity

Connectivity of adsorption site for adsorbate to bind.

Type:

list, tuple, None

avg_coord_num

Average coordination of adsorption site for adsorbate to bind.

Type:

list, tuple, None

rotation

Rotation of adsorbate.

Type:

list, tuple, None

Examples

adsorbate_set = AdsorbateSpecificationsSet() adsorbate_set.adsorbate_atoms = [‘H’] adsorbate_set.adsorbate_formula = [‘H’] adsorbate_set.bonds = [[0]] #monodentate [[0,1]] #bidentate adsorbate_set.connectivity = [[1]] adsorbate_set.avg_coord_num = [[7.0]] #monodentate [[‘<=9.0’]] #monodentate comparator adsorbate_set.avg_coord_num = [[7.0,8.0]] #bidentate [[‘<=9.0’,’<=9.0’]] #bidentate comparator adsorbate_set.rotation = [0,90,180]

SPECIFICATIONS_CLASS

alias of AdsorbateSpecifications

adsorbate_formula: list[str | None] | tuple[str | None] | None = None
avg_coord_num: list[list | tuple | int | float | None] | tuple[list | tuple | int | float | None] | None = None
bonds: list[list | tuple | str | None] | tuple[list | tuple | str | None] | None = None
property bonds_denticity
check_adsorbate_inputs()[source]

Checks for the following: 1) Bonds denticity does not exceed adsorbate length. 2) Denticities are consistent over bonds, connectivity and avg_coord_num.

connectivity: list[list | tuple | int | None] | tuple[list | tuple | int | None] | None = None

property is_avg_coord_num_specified

catplat.specifications.bulk module

class catplat.specifications.bulk.BulkSpecifications[source]

Bases: Specifications, ABC

classmethod from_attr(bulk_atoms=None, **kwargs)[source]
abstract generate_atoms()[source]
class catplat.specifications.bulk.BulkSpecificationsSet(bulk_atoms: list[str | Atoms | AtomsWrapper | GratomsWrapper | None] | tuple[str | Atoms | AtomsWrapper | GratomsWrapper | None] | None = None, e_above_hull: list[str | float | int | None] | tuple[str | float | int | None] | None = None, bulk_formula: list[str | None] | tuple[str | None] | None = None, chemsys: list[str | None] | tuple[str | None] | None = None, spacegroup: list[int | None] | tuple[int | None] | None = None, mpid: list[str | None] | tuple[str | None] | None = None, bulk_provenance: list[str | None] | tuple[str | None] | None = None)[source]

Bases: SpecificationsSet

Main class containing the bulk attributes provided by the user.

Also contains some error checks for the attributes which are called in the QuerySet.

bulk_atoms

Name of bulk file in user’s bulk directory (~/.autopy/bulk or ~/autopy/autopy/data/bulk). When bulk is specified, other bulk attributes such as ‘e_above_hull’ should not be specified.

Type:

list, tuple, None

e_above_hull

Energy above hull of the bulk structure as indicated on Materials Project. Comparator strings are preferred over float unless exact match is desired.

Type:

list, tuple, None

bulk_formula

Bulk formula as indicated on Materials Project.

Type:

list, tuple, None

chemsys

Chemical system is a string of a list of elements sorted alphabetically and joined by dashes, by convention for use in database keys.

Type:

list, tuple, None

spacegroup

Spacegroup number of bulk as indicated on Materials Project.

Type:

list, tuple, None

mpid

Materials Project id of bulk atoms.

Type:

list, tuple, None

bulk_provenance

String for the origin of bulk atoms. Can be [‘user-bulk’] or [‘autopy-bulk’] or [None]

Type:

list, tuple, None

Examples

bulk_set = BulkSpecificationsSet() bulk_set.bulk_atoms = [‘user_bulk’] bulk_set.e_above_hull = [‘<0.001’] #comparator [0.0] #float [0] #int bulk_set.bulk_formula = [‘Cu3Rh’] bulk_set.chemsys = [‘Cu’] bulk_set.spacegroup = [221] bulk_set.bulk_provenance = [‘user-bulk’]

SPECIFICATIONS_CLASS

alias of BulkSpecifications

bulk_provenance: list[str | None] | tuple[str | None] | None = None

chemsys: str | None = None

generate_atoms(existing_atoms=None, skip_materials_project=False)[source]

Generate bulk atoms from user’s bulk directory.

Parameters:

  • existing_atoms (list, tuple, None) – List of atoms objects to check against.

  • skip_materials_project (bool) – If True, skip querying Materials Project. This is not used and only here to maintain consistency with the MPBulkSpecifications class.

mpid: str | None = None
own_query_db_criteria()[source]
spacegroup: int | None = None

class catplat.specifications.other.OtherSpecificationsSet(id: list[int | str | None] | tuple[int | str | None] | None = None, workflow_type: list[str | None] | tuple[str | None] | None = None, relaxed: list[bool | None] | tuple[bool | None] | None = None, unrelaxed_id: list[int | None] | tuple[int | None] | None = None, parent_id: list[int | None] | tuple[int | None] | None = None, errored: list[bool | None] | tuple[bool | None] | None = None, ignored: list[bool | None] | tuple[bool | None] | None = None, version: list[str | None] | tuple[str | None] | None = None, session_id: list[str | None] | tuple[str | None] | None = None, ml_preoptimization: list[bool | None] | tuple[bool | None] | None = None, ml_preoptimization_id: list[bool | None] | tuple[bool | None] | None = None)[source]

Bases: SpecificationsSet

Main class containing the other attributes provided by the user.

id

List of database id of query.

Type:

list, tuple, None

workflow_type

List of workflow type of query. Three workflow types, namely, “bulk”, “slab” and “adsorbate”.

Type:

list, tuple, None

relaxed

List of boolean specifying if structures to be queried are relaxed or not.

Type:

list, tuple, None

unrelaxed_id

List of unrelaxed database id of query.

Type:

list, tuple, None

parent_id

List of parent id of query.

Type:

list, tuple, None

errored

List of bool to show if calculation errored.

Type:

list, tuple, None

ignored

LIst of bool to filter attributes with the ignore flag.

Type:

list, tuple, None

version

List of version number used for calculation.

Type:

list, tuple, None

session_id

List of session id of calcaulation.

Type:

list, tuple, None

Examples

other_set = OtherSpecificationsSet() other_set.id = [1] other_set.workflow_type = [‘bulk’] other_set.relaxed = [True] other_set.unrelaxed_id = [1] other_set.parent_id = [1] other_set.errored = [False] other_set.version = [‘22.12.13’] other_set.session_id = [‘LGlF6g’]

class catplat.specifications.slab.SlabSpecificationsSet(slab_atoms: list[str | Atoms | AtomsWrapper | GratomsWrapper | None] | tuple[str | Atoms | AtomsWrapper | GratomsWrapper | None] | None = None, termination: list[str | None] | tuple[str | None] | None = None, overlayer: list[str | None] | tuple[str | None] | None = None, miller_index: list[list | tuple | None] | tuple[list | tuple | None] | None = None, unitcell_size: list[list | tuple | None] | tuple[list | tuple | None] | None = None, num_layers: list[int | None] | tuple[int | None] | None = None, num_fixed_layers: list[int | None] | tuple[int | None] | None = None, vacuum: list[str | float | int | None] | tuple[str | float | int | None] | None = None, conventional: list[bool | None] | tuple[bool | None] | None = None, slab_provenance: list[str | None] | tuple[str | None] | None = None, x_length: list[str | float | int | None] | tuple[str | float | int | None] | None = None, y_length: list[str | float | int | None] | tuple[str | float | int | None] | None = None, slab_thickness: list[str | float | int | None] | tuple[str | float | int | None] | None = None, slab_fixed_thickness: list[str | float | int | None] | tuple[str | float | int | None] | None = None, slab_chemsys: list[str | None] | tuple[str | None] | None = None, slab_formula: list[str | None] | tuple[str | None] | None = None, slab_acn: list[str | float | int | None] | tuple[str | float | int | None] | None = None)[source]

Bases: SpecificationsSet

Main class containing the slab attributes provided by the user.

Also contains some error checks for the attributes which are called in the QuerySet.

slab_atoms

Name of slab file in user’s slab directory. (~/.autopy/slab or ~/autopy/autopy/data/slab). When slab is specified, other bulk and slab attributes should not be specified.

Type:

list, tuple

termination

Slab termination of alloy.

Type:

list, tuple, None

overlayer

Replaces top layer atoms with overlayer atoms.

Type:

list, tuple, None

miller_index

Miller index of slab to be created.

Type:

list, tuple, None

unitcell_size

Size of slab to be created.

Type:

list, tuple, None

num_layers

Number of layers of the slab.

Type:

list, tuple, None

num_fixed_layers

Number of layers to be fixed.

Type:

list, tuple, None

slab_fixed_thickness

Fixed atoms cutoff in Angstroms.

Type:

float, None

vacuum

Amount of vacuum (in angstroms) to add on “each side” of the slab (i.e., total vacuum = vauum x 2) Vacuum should be an int.

Type:

list, tuple, None

conventional

Toggle for creation of conventional slabs.

Type:

list, tuple, None

slab_provenance

String for the origin of slab atoms. Can be [‘autopy-slab’] or [‘user-bulk’]

Type:

list, tuple, None

#TODO

Update documentation

Examples

slab_set = SlabSpecificationsSet() slab_set.slab_atoms = [‘user_slab’] slab_set.termination = [‘Cu’] slab_set.overlayer = [‘Cu’] slab_set.miller_index = [(1,1,1)] slab_set.unitcell_size = [(2,2)] slab_set.num_layers = [4] slab_set.num_fixed_layers = [2] slab_set.slab_fixed_thickness = [2] slab_set.vacuum = [10] slab_set.conventional = [True] slab_set.slab_provenance = [‘user-slab’]

catplat.specifications.specifications module

class catplat.specifications.specifications.DictAttributesMetaclass(future_class_name, future_class_parents, future_class_attrs, other_attrs=None, types=None)[source]

Bases: ABCMeta

class catplat.specifications.specifications.Specifications[source]

Bases: ABC

Data that specifies how to build parts of the catalytic model. Subclasses implement the specific properties for different parts of the model.

Should not have any default values to prevent surprises.

is_empty()[source]
own_query_db_criteria()[source]
